name: Dramatic Lives of Creative People Trivia Game | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: This wildly creative writer married his 13 year old cousin, before ultimately succumbing to poverty and alcoholism at a young age.
questions.explanation:
Edgar Allan Poe.

	Poe had a great imagination - but a truly terrible life.

questions.text: This writer also died at a very young age, brought about by pneumonia on a trip to the Northwest.
This writer had major personal problems; psychologists love him (and Poe). His 'Letter to His Father' is a classic, as is his romance with 'Felice'.
questions.explanation:
Franz Kafka.

	Another unhappy and short life.

questions.text: This writer somewhat revolutionized literature with the sexual content of his writing.
questions.explanation:
D. H. Lawrence

	Again, his time was short.

questions.text: This writer was known largely for his masochism and his wild life style.
questions.explanation:
Algernon Charles Swinburne.

	He was quite a character!

questions.text: This writer 'lived the adventure' by exploring Alaska.
questions.explanation:
Jack London.

	Another who died young

questions.text: This writer died in his 40's in a car accident.
questions.explanation:
Albert Camus.

	Tough way to go

questions.text: This writer sustained a serious injury to his arm during the Battle of Lepanto.
questions.explanation:
Miguel de Cervantes.

	He was known as the 'manco (cripple) of Lepanto'

questions.text: Which writer did NOT die by drowning?
questions.explanation:
William Inge.

	Inge poisoned himself via carbon monoxide. Crane committed suicide by jumping overboard; Woolf also committed suicide by walking into the River Ouse weighed down by stones. Shelley drowned in an accident.

questions.text: Which person did NOT suffer from either blindness or deafness?
questions.explanation:
F Scott Fitzgerald.

	Beethoven and Goya were deaf; Milton was blind. Fitzgerald merely drank.
